normalised: **E V Charging Getting a Desi Twist!**

unnormalised: Hey folks! The EV revolution is definitely picking up speed here in India, but the big question remains: where do we charge 'em up?
normalised: Hey folks! The E V revolution is definitely picking up speed here in India, but the big question remains: where do we charge 'em up?

unnormalised: Well, things are looking bright! IIT-Madras is reportedly working on some super-efficient charging tech that could drastically reduce charging times. Imagine zipping up your EV faster than it takes to make a good cup of chai!
normalised: Well, things are looking bright! I I T-Madras is reportedly working on some super-efficient charging tech that could drastically reduce charging times. Imagine zipping up your E V faster than it takes to make a good cup of chai!

unnormalised: And it's not just the big institutions. We're seeing local entrepreneurs in places like Kochi and Pune setting up charging stations, often partnering with kirana stores or restaurants. Imagine charging while you grab some yummy biryani!
normalised: And it's not just the big institutions. We're seeing local entrepreneurs in places like Kochi and Pune setting up charging stations, often partnering with kirana stores or restaurants. Imagine charging while you grab some yummy biryani!

unnormalised: Speaking of South India, ahead of Onam, Kerala is boosting its EV charging infrastructure along major highways to cater to the holiday rush. No range anxiety ruining your festive travel plans!
normalised: Speaking of South India, ahead of Onam, Kerala is boosting its E V charging infrastructure along major highways to cater to the holiday rush. No range anxiety ruining your festive travel plans!

unnormalised: Some companies are even experimenting with mobile charging vans, bringing the power to you. Think of it as a roadside assistance, but for electrons!
normalised: Some companies are even experimenting with mobile charging vans, bringing the power to you. Think of it as a roadside assistance, but for electrons!

unnormalised: Prices are still a bit of a hurdle (around Rs. 10-12 per unit), but with increased competition and government incentives, experts predict those will come down soon.
normalised: Prices are still a bit of a hurdle (around rupees ten to twelve per unit), but with increased competition and government incentives, experts predict those will come down soon.

unnormalised: Range is also improving, with newer models promising 400-500 km on a single charge. The future of EV is here, and it's looking electric!
normalised: Range is also improving, with newer models promising four hundred to five hundred kilometer on a single charge. The future of E V is here, and it's looking electric!

unnormalised: Get ready to hit the road, responsibly!
normalised: Get ready to hit the road, responsibly!
